snippet: Many Germans, egged on by local media, are angered over  a European Central Bank study that concludes they are among the poorest people in Europe.
abstract: Many Germans, egged on by local media, are angered over European Central Bank study that concludes they are among poorest people in Europe, with fewer assets than even Greeks or Cypriots; study suggests that countries like Greece have hidden stashes of property wealth.

byline.contributor: Chris Cottrell contributed reporting from Berlin.

lead_paragraph: Many Germans, egged on by local media, are angered over  a European Central Bank study that concludes they are among the poorest people in Europe.

headline.seo: Wealth Study Heats Up Euro Crisis Debate in Germany
headline.main: Study on Wealth Fuels Euro Crisis Debate in Germany
headline.print_headline: Report on Wealth Provokes Germans Already Angry About Euro Crisis
